newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on interbank and retail interest, dealers said on Wednesday.

"The interbank rate was marked up slightly today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were slightly higher but bond prices were steady to slightly higher. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 1.60/55 percent compared with Tuesday's yield of 1.56/1.51 percent and one-year at a yield of 1.72/1.67 percent against 1.70/1.65 percent.
Among bonds, April 1998 was unchanged from Tuesday's close of S$99.53/99.58.
September 2001 ended at S$96.70/96.75 versus Tuesday's close of S$96.67/96.72 and June 2003 at S$94.73/94.78 against S$94.68/94.73.
The interbank rate rose to 3-1/2 3-3/8 percent from Tuesday's 3-3/8 3-1/4 percent.
